title: Slack, Peloton Are Down for Some Users; Messaging company says it is investigating an issue where the platform isn't loading properly; fitness-equipment maker also reported technical issues
text:
"We're still monitoring the situation," Slack said. "We'll confirm once this issue is fully resolved."

There were more than 10,000 reports of Slack outages at around 9:30 a.m. ET, according to Downdetector, which tracks website outages. The number of reported outages decreased significantly by early afternoon.

Exercise-bike company Peloton also was having technical issues on Tuesday. The company said in a tweet shortly after 11 a.m. that it was investigating an issue with its services. Downdetector showed 5,490 reports of the service being down as of 10:38 a.m.

Temporary interruptions for popular social-media sites, websites and messaging platforms are relatively common. Some of the outages have been felt more widespread as many employees turn to cloud services and other connected platforms to help them work remotely during the pandemic.

Salesforce.com Inc. said in late 2020 that it agreed to purchase Slack in a $27.7 billion deal. The deal closed in July 2021.
